alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 3:29PM EST until January 18 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in soundside low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Northern Outer Banks, including Colington and Roanoke Islands. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 PM EST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 8 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront may experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/07 PM 3.3 2.7 3.0 3 Minor 18/07 AM 2.9 2.3 2.5 2 None 18/08 PM 1.8 1.2 1.5 1 None 19/09 AM 2.0 1.4 1.5 1 None 19/10 PM 2.1 1.5 1.7 1 None 20/09 AM 2.5 1.9 2.0 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
